event.location: On the roadside, 15 miles east of the southern port city of Sidon
event.summary: 07/08/1993: Guerrillas of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine- General Command planted a roadside bomb on a dusty path in the eastern sector of the ''security zone'' imposed by Israel, some 15 miles east of the southern port city of Sidon. Two Israeli soldiers were killed and three others were wounded, while the attackers escaped unharmed, the security sources said.
event.gname: Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, Gen Cmd (PFLP-GC)
event.scite1: “At Least one Dead, Three Wounded in Lebanon Flare-up,” Agence France Presse, July 9, 1993.
event.scite2: “Israeli Soldiers killed in South Lebanon,” Xinhua, July 8, 1993.
event.scite3: Mohammed Darweesh, “Two Israeli soldiers killed in south Lebanon,” United Press International, July 8, 1993.
